text: green garlic spring onions and rhubarb
make this skillet chicken dish bright
fresh and very seasonal if you have time
it's always a good idea to salt your
chicken ahead I put this in the fridge
this morning with some lemon thyme and I
just let it sit all day so that it
absorbs the seasonings evenly and now
I'm gonna Brown it you need enough oil
to coat the bottom of the pan so many of
the best recipes start out just like
this so you want to save this lemon
thyme and by the way you can use a
regular time if you can't find lemon
thyme but you don't want to add this to
earlier it could burn I'm just gonna add
my chicken skin side down when you're
done browning your chicken you want to
just add some onions right into the
chicken fat of the pan and the onions
are gonna help deglaze all of that
gorgeous brown stuff there that is your
flavor and while those cook for a minute
let me play about the green garlic
garlic it starts out like this in the
ground like this and these guys
eventually get fatter and fatter and
fatter until they become the garlic
heads that we all know and love but when
you use them when there's this young and
slender
they are so mild and so sweet they're
just delicious so good ever see these
buy them and use them immediately like
kind of peel them like scallions and
then I just like and if you can't find
them use to regular garlic one by each
other after the onions start to soften
remember the lemon thyme that I
marinated the chicken with it's gonna
throw that right in there and then
that's my green garlic pinch of salt
it's gonna cook this until I start to
smell of garlic and now I'm going to add
a little bit of wine to the bottom of
the skillet and this helps lift up those
brown bits which as you can see they are
stubbornly staying
a little more help and then once the
wine is pretty much evaporated from the
pants that's when you can add your
rhubarb most people think of rhubarb is
fruit but in fact it's a vegetable with
a wonderful tartness that's just as good
in savory dishes as it is in dessert the
rhubarb is really sour so if you don't
add honey this dish could be a little
too tart and now I'm just gonna put the
chicken right on top of the vegetables
see how pretty this looks right now
well admire it now because this is one
of those rare dishes that gets uglier
and uglier as it goes now I'm just gonna
lower the heat this is gonna take about
maybe 15 to 25 minutes you can cut into
it if you want to check for picniced or
if you're an expert you can just use
your finger and go tap top you do the
test you take your thumb and you go like
this and if you make a muscle and you
press down that's what you want chicken
to feel like once your chicken is all
cooked you can just put it on your
serving platter and then you finish the
sauce right in the skillet and now I'm
just gonna whisk a little butter into
the sauce add just a little bit of honey
to the pan and do this to taste because
you just don't know how tart your
rhubarb is gonna be and then that's it
the sauce is ready I'm just gonna spoon
it on the chicken and then I'm gonna
decorate the plate I saved the tops of
my spring onions or you could also use
chives these add great flavor they're
very bright tasting this may not start
out as the prettiest dish but it sure
ends up looking delicious
Oh
